title: Jordon Hudson takes shot at Robert Kraft with controversial T-shirt
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jordon Hudson wore an 'Orchids of Asia' T-shirt, referencing Robert Kraft's 2019 scandal, at a UNC-Duke game.
Robert Kraft faced dropped solicitation charges in 2020 after a judge ruled the surveillance warrant violated privacy rights.
Kraft and Bill Belichick both missed the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026; Kraft praised Belichick's coaching legacy.

title: Patriots Super Bowl LX live updates: Can Pats beat Seahawks to clinch title?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots face Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium, aiming for a historic seventh NFL title.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel emphasized 'Belief, Identity, Rage' in a team meeting, referencing an underdog victory in Super Bowl XXXVI.
Game broadcast available on NBC and 98.5 The Sports Hub, with favorable weather forecast for Santa Clara kickoff.

title: Holy Cross dedicates court to Bob Cousy
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Holy Cross named its home court 'Bob Cousy ’50 Court' in Worcester to honor Celtics legend Bob Cousy.
Bob Cousy, 97, attended the court dedication ceremony during a basketball game against Lehigh.
Guests included The Ringer CEO Bill Simmons and NCAA President Charlie Baker, with fans receiving purple 'Cousys'.

title: Healey proposes eliminating statute of limitations for rape when DNA evidence exists
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey proposes eliminating Massachusetts' 15-year statute of limitations for rape when DNA evidence is present.
The proposal requires storing sexual assault evidence kits for at least 15 years to preserve DNA evidence.
The plan includes quick evidence transfer and testing mandates, and follows efforts against sex trafficking statewide.

title: Watch: Patriots share hype video ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: The New England Patriots released a hype video ahead of Super Bowl LX against the Seattle Seahawks.
Head Coach Mike Vrabel emphasized team identity and performance in the video, focusing on maximizing player potential.
Wide receiver Stefon Diggs is featured motivating teammates with the message, 'Ain’t nobody like us.'

title: Former employee at Mass. post office pleads guilty after secretly recording female co-workers
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nicholas Testagrossa, 43, of Rindge, N.H., pleaded guilty to video voyeurism and obstruction at a Westminster post office.
Testagrossa secretly recorded female co-workers in the bathroom and attempted to destroy evidence, authorities reported.
He faces up to 20 years in prison for obstruction and one year for voyeurism, with sentencing set for May 12, 2026.

title: Jewish groups sue Medford over values-based investment ordinance
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jewish groups filed a federal lawsuit against Medford's values-based investment ordinance, claiming it mandates divestment based on ideology.
The lawsuit argues Medford's ordinance violates Massachusetts investment rules, prioritizing ethics over financial return requirements.
Medford's city council enacted the ordinance, overriding a mayoral veto, despite legal concerns about financial and state law compliance.

title: Eight things Patriots must do to win Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots need an MVP-level performance from Drake Maye to overcome Seattle's top-ranked defense in Super Bowl LX.
New England must win the turnover battle and apply pressure on Seattle QB Sam Darnold to force mistakes.
Cornerback Christian Gonzalez will likely shadow Jaxon Smith-Njigba to limit Seattle's offensive impact through the air.

title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest wore No. 55 at USC, a tradition started by Junior Seau for top linebackers.
McGinest continued wearing No. 55 with the Patriots, playing 11 seasons and winning three Super Bowls.
Junior Seau asked McGinest's blessing to wear No. 55 in 2006, marking a respectful exchange between them.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County was the hardest hit area, with Salisbury and Beverly each receiving 13 inches of snow.
Bristol County reported up to 8.2 inches of snow, with Dartmouth receiving the highest amount.
Snow observers and the National Weather Service provided snow totals for towns across Massachusetts from the February 7 storm.
